title: View Pantry Items
want: View my pantry as a list of items currently at home
benefit: I can quickly see what ingredients and food I have available without opening every cabinet and fridge shelf
criteria: Pantry screen displays all added items in a scrollable list
Each item shows name, quantity, category, and expiration date if set
Empty state displays a helpful message prompting the user to add their first item
List updates in real time when items are added or removed
subtasks: Create PantryScreen component with list layout
Implement pantry item data model and local storage schema
Build PantryItemCard component displaying item details
Add empty state illustration and onboarding prompt

title: Manually Add Pantry Item
want: Manually add an item to my pantry by typing its name and optional details such as quantity, expiration date, and category
benefit: I can keep an accurate digital record of what I have at home even when I add items one at a time
criteria: User can enter an item name (required) and optionally set quantity, expiration date, and category
Category can be selected from a predefined list or entered as custom text
Newly added item appears immediately in the pantry list
Form validates that name is not empty before allowing submission
subtasks: Create AddItemForm component with name, quantity, expiration, and category fields
Implement category picker with predefined options and custom entry
Wire form submission to pantry state management and persistence layer
Add input validation and user feedback on successful addition

title: Remove Pantry Item
want: Remove items from my pantry when they are used up
benefit: My pantry list stays accurate and only reflects what I actually have on hand
criteria: User can remove an item via a delete action on the item card
A confirmation prompt appears before permanent deletion
Removed item disappears from the pantry list immediately
Undo option is available briefly after deletion
subtasks: Add delete button or swipe-to-delete gesture on PantryItemCard
Implement confirmation dialog before removal
Update pantry state and persistence layer on deletion
Add temporary undo snackbar after item removal

title: Edit Pantry Item Details
want: Edit item details including name, quantity, and expiration date
benefit: I can correct mistakes and update quantities as I use portions of an item without removing and re-adding it
criteria: User can tap an item to open an edit form pre-populated with current values
All editable fields (name, quantity, expiration) can be modified and saved
Changes are reflected immediately in the pantry list after saving
Cancel action discards changes and returns to the pantry list
subtasks: Create EditItemForm component reusing AddItemForm fields
Pre-populate form with existing item data on open
Implement save and cancel actions with appropriate state updates
Add validation to prevent saving an item with an empty name

title: Organize Pantry by Category
want: See my pantry items organized by category such as produce, dairy, proteins, grains, spices, and canned goods
benefit: I can quickly find specific types of ingredients and get a sense of what food groups I have stocked
criteria: Pantry list can be toggled to a category-grouped view
Each category section has a header and shows the count of items within it
Categories with no items are hidden from the grouped view
Items without a category are placed under a general or uncategorized section
subtasks: Define default category list (produce, dairy, proteins, grains, spices, canned goods, other)
Implement grouped list view with collapsible category sections
Add toggle control to switch between flat list and category-grouped view
Handle uncategorized items with a fallback section

title: Search and Filter Pantry Items
want: Search and filter my pantry items
benefit: I can instantly find a specific item without scrolling through my entire pantry list
criteria: A search bar at the top of the pantry screen filters items as the user types
Search matches against item name and category
Filter chips or dropdown allow filtering by category
Clear search button resets the list to show all items
subtasks: Add search bar component to the pantry screen header
Implement real-time filtering logic matching name and category fields
Add category filter chips below the search bar
Implement clear/reset functionality for search and filters

title: Photo-Add Groceries to Pantry
want: Take a photo of my groceries or ingredients and have the app automatically identify items to quickly add to my pantry
benefit: I can stock my pantry in seconds after a grocery trip instead of manually typing every item
criteria: User can open the camera from the pantry screen to capture a photo of groceries
App sends the photo to an image recognition service and returns a list of identified items
Identified items are presented for review before being added to the pantry
Processing state is clearly indicated with a loading indicator
subtasks: Integrate device camera access with capture-photo flow from pantry screen
Implement API call to image recognition service with the captured photo
Parse recognition response into a list of pantry item candidates
Display loading and error states during photo processing

title: Photo-Identify Single Item
want: Take a photo of a single item for identification
benefit: I can identify an unfamiliar ingredient or product and add it to my pantry with the correct name and category
criteria: User can photograph a single item and receive its identified name and suggested category
Recognition returns a confidence score and the top identification result
User can accept the identification or manually correct the name before adding
Photo can be taken from the add-item flow as an alternative to typing
subtasks: Add single-item photo capture mode in the add-item flow
Send photo to recognition API and parse single-item response
Display identification result with confidence indicator
Allow user to accept or override the identified name and category

title: Photo-Identify Multiple Items
want: Take a photo of multiple items and have the app identify all visible items
benefit: I can add many items at once from a single photo saving significant time when unloading groceries
criteria: App detects and identifies multiple distinct items within a single photo
Each identified item is listed separately with its name and suggested category
Items are visually annotated or numbered so the user can match identifications to the photo
Recognition handles at least 5-10 items per photo with reasonable accuracy
subtasks: Implement multi-object detection pipeline in the recognition API call
Parse multi-item response into individual pantry item candidates
Build UI to display annotated photo alongside the list of identified items
Handle edge cases for overlapping or partially hidden items

title: Review and Confirm Photo-Identified Items
want: Review and confirm identified items before adding them to my pantry, including editing names, removing incorrect identifications, and adding missed items
benefit: I maintain full control over what goes into my pantry list and can correct any recognition errors before they are saved
criteria: A review screen lists all identified items with editable name and category fields
User can remove any incorrectly identified item from the list
User can manually add missed items that were not identified
A confirm button adds all approved items to the pantry in one action
subtasks: Create ReviewIdentifiedItemsScreen with an editable list of candidates
Add inline edit controls for item name and category on each row
Implement remove and manual-add actions on the review list
Wire confirm action to batch-add all approved items to the pantry

title: Photo-Scan Receipt to Add Items
want: Take a photo of a receipt to extract purchased items
benefit: I can populate my pantry from a store receipt without re-typing every line item
criteria: User can photograph a grocery receipt and have the app extract item names
Extracted items are presented in a review list before being added to the pantry
Common receipt abbreviations are expanded to recognizable item names where possible
User is informed if the receipt is unreadable or no items could be extracted
subtasks: Integrate OCR service for receipt text extraction from a captured photo
Implement parsing logic to identify line items and filter out non-item text like totals and tax
Map common receipt abbreviations to full item names using a lookup table
Route extracted items to the ReviewIdentifiedItemsScreen for confirmation

title: View Items Expiring Soon
want: See items that are expiring soon so I can use them before they go bad
benefit: I reduce food waste and save money by prioritizing ingredients that need to be used first
criteria: A dedicated section or filter shows items expiring within a configurable number of days
Items are sorted by expiration date with the soonest at the top
Expired items are visually distinguished from items that are expiring soon
Items without an expiration date are excluded from this view
subtasks: Create ExpiringSoonSection component with date-based filtering logic
Sort filtered items by expiration date ascending
Add visual indicators (color coding or badges) for expired vs. expiring-soon items
Allow user to configure the expiring-soon threshold in settings

title: Expiration Notifications
want: Get notified when items are about to expire
benefit: I am proactively reminded to use perishable items even when I am not actively checking my pantry
criteria: App sends a push notification when an item is within the expiring-soon threshold
Notification includes the item name and how many days until expiration
User can enable or disable expiration notifications in settings
Notifications are not sent for items without an expiration date
subtasks: Implement local notification scheduling based on item expiration dates
Create notification content template with item name and days remaining
Add notification toggle and threshold settings in the app settings screen
Reschedule or cancel notifications when items are removed or edited

title: Pantry Category Summary
want: See a summary of what categories of food I have available
benefit: I get a quick high-level overview of my pantry balance and can spot gaps in my food stock at a glance
criteria: A summary view shows each category with the number of items in it
Categories with zero items are displayed as empty to highlight gaps
Summary is accessible from the pantry screen header or a dedicated tab
Tapping a category navigates to the filtered list of items in that category
subtasks: Create PantrySummary component that aggregates items by category
Design summary cards or bar chart showing item counts per category
Implement navigation from a summary category to the filtered pantry list
Handle empty categories with visual indication of missing stock

title: AI Chat Pantry Recipe Suggestions
want: Ask the AI chat 'What can I cook with what's in my pantry?' and get suggestions based on my actual pantry items
benefit: I get personalized meal ideas that use what I already have, reducing the need to buy extra ingredients
criteria: AI chat can access the current pantry item list when generating recipe suggestions
Suggestions only use ingredients available in the pantry or flag any extras needed
Responses include recipe names, brief descriptions, and the pantry items they use
User can ask follow-up questions to refine suggestions based on preferences or constraints
subtasks: Expose pantry data as context to the AI chat service when pantry-related queries are detected
Implement prompt engineering to generate recipe suggestions from a list of available ingredients
Format AI response to clearly list recipes, required pantry items, and any missing ingredients
Add pantry-aware intent detection to route relevant queries to the enriched prompt

title: Feed Recipes Matching Pantry
want: See recipe posts in the feed that can be made with my current pantry items or with minimal extra ingredients
benefit: I discover relevant recipes passively while browsing and can cook them without a separate shopping trip
criteria: Feed includes a filter or tag highlighting recipes that match the user's pantry
Matching logic considers recipes where at least 80% of ingredients are in the pantry
Each matching recipe shows how many pantry items it uses and how many extras are needed
Filter can be toggled on and off without leaving the feed screen
subtasks: Implement ingredient-matching algorithm comparing recipe ingredients to pantry items
Add a pantry-match badge or indicator on recipe post cards in the feed
Create a feed filter toggle for showing only pantry-compatible recipes
Display matched and missing ingredient counts on each recipe card
